Name: Das Spritzhaus Hefeweizen
Taste: Light beer, hint of sweetness, fruity flavour, as well as a bit of bitterness. Fairly well balanced. Also a bit of carbonation
Finish: Little to no after taste, excellent finish

Name: Lemon of Troy
Taste: Fizzy, very sweet, tastes like a soda. Similar to Amsterdam Brewery's spotted cow

Name: Original Alcoholic Ginger Beer
Taste: Sweet ginger flavours, slightly flizzy, like drinking a soda (does not feel like a beer at all)

Name: Release The Hounds - Black IPA
Aroma: Slight cherry notes, bit of citrus-y IPA aroma; slight hint of alcohol
Taste: Met with an initial sweet cherry, citrus-y taste; sort of tangy, zesty; then met with those sharp hops; extremely well balanced. Definitely on the stronger side with respects to bitterness, but really well done, really fun beer

Name: Spotted Cow White Wheat
Aroma: Smells sugary, like a soda, orange notes, wonderful aroma
Taste: Sweet, with a hint of bitter notes, light and balanced, slightly spicy/fizzy

Name: White
Aroma: Wonderful citrus-y aroma, with floral notes
Taste: Sweet, tastes sort of fruity, slightly bitter, hint of carbonation -- may be a bit on the sweet side. Really unique
Finish: Slightly spicy, the elderflower hits you right as the beer goes down, and a slightly malty finish.

Name: Beauty and the Belgian
Aroma: Hint of lychee-like, floral notes, great aroma
Taste: Good balance of sweet and bitter flavours, flavour is fairly light for a strong beer, very refreshing.

Name: Bodacious Blueberry
Taste: Amazing beer. Light blueberry taste. Very smooth beer, with no offensive characteristics

Name: Cakeface
Taste: Spicy, sweet, zesty, like alcoholic orange fanta

Name: Hop House 13 - Lager
Taste: Extremely sweet (straight up tastes like lychee), slightly hoppy, clean, crisp

Name: Hopped and Confused
Aroma: Can smell the hops, along with a hint of fruity aroma
Taste: fruity, tropical, sweet, not too hoppy; really well balanced, creamy
Finish: Fairly clean finish, some lingering bitter flavours

Name: Moosehead Lager
Taste: Well-balanced, rich flavours, slightly fizzy

Name: Upper Canada Repatriation Lager
Taste: Maple-like flavours, slightly bitter, really smooth

Name: Zodiak
Taste: Fruity (peach, pineapple, citrus), balanced bitter notes, carbonated, frothy

Name: Ball's Falls Session IPA
Taste: Very sweet, the bitter flavours come in waves and mesh with the fruity flavours fairly well. Lots of carbonation. Not heavy at all

Name: Belgian moon
Taste: Carbonated, slightly sweet, cider-y flavour with hint of hoppy taste

Name: Black Raspberry Thunder
Aroma: Like smelling a berry shake from Booster juice, with a hint of bubblegum
Taste: Fairly well-balanced between the sweet and bitter flavours, both coming from the raspberry and vanilla added to the drink. Also feels like a very light rosé; tastes much sweeter than you might expect from a beer.

Name: Blonde Ale
Taste: Nice, full-bodied, wheaty flavour, balanced with the hops

Name: Blue County (Blueberry Saison)
Description: Honey, dark golden color, translucent, little carbonation
Taste: Well balanced, hint of sweetnes and malty flavours, slightly carbonated
Finish: Very smooth, goes down with only a little wheaty, oaty aftertaste

Name: Carte Blanche
Taste: Light, slightly orangy, clove-like taste. Balanced

Name: Gaslight Helles Lager
Taste: Slightly tropical taste, sweet, balanced, fizzy

Name: Geronimo IPA
Aroma: Light yeasty aroma with a hint of floral notes and hops
Taste: Fairly  well balanced, light sweetness complements the hoppy flavours

Name: Hills Vienna Lager
Aroma: lychee, zesty aroma. Hint of bready notes
Taste: Crisp, clean taste. Has bitter notes, but not overbearing. Hint of honey, slightly fruity sweetness

Name: Hoegaarden White
Taste: Fizzy, sweet, tastes like a sparkling mixed fruit juice with a hint of hops

Name: Houston, We Have A Porter
Taste: Rich chocolate flavours, great balance of sweetness and bitterness, very smooth

Name: Inn O'Slainte (Irish Red Ale)
Taste: Very balanced; slightly bitter, hint of coffee-like taste; malty flavours are very light
Finish: Smooth finish; hint of bitter aftertaste

Name: Lug Tread Lagered Ale
Aroma: Slightly bready, hint of fruity notes
Taste: More on the dry side, with hints of sweetness; malty; lots of carbonation

Name: Maple Rush
Description: Dark cloudy color, looks like Chinese medicine
Aroma: Maple, toffee-like aroma, with a hint of dryness
Taste: Frothy, can realy taste that maple flavour, bitterness comes from the maple more so than the hops. Hint of chocolate flavouring. Malty.

Name: Munchner Gold
Taste: Really bready; honey-like subtle sweetness; just a hint of bitterness. Light, but flavourful; crisp and easy to drink

Name: Pilsner
Taste: Quite balanced flavours: slightly sweet and bitter, but not overly strong; crisp. Slightly fizzy

Name: Premium Pilsner
Taste: Light hoppy punch, strong wheaty flavours, very balanced

Name: Red Smashed in Buffalo Jump
Taste: Fizzy, slightly sweet, balanced

Name: Settle Down (Coffee pale ale)
Taste: Deep coffee taste with a hint of chocolate flavours. Smokey. Fizzy.
Finish: Smokey aroma lingers in your mouth

Name: Sixes and Sevens
Taste: Zesty, fruity, orange peel like flavour, balanced

Name: Superstitious Intuition
Taste: Very balanced fruity (pineapple) taste; slightly hoppy, fizzy

Name: Wheat
Taste: Fizzy and bittersweet. Very light beer.
Finish: Little to no after taste, excellent finish

Name: A-Bay Pale Ale
Taste: Light IPA-like taste, tangerine-y, grapefruit-y; very balanced between the hoppy and fruity flavours. Unexpectedly flavourful for a pale ale. Less crisp than I had hoped, but still very drinkable

Name: Anchor Brew Beer
Taste: Fairly balanced; sweet; weird tart, tangy taste, a bit unexpected; not too bitter, and the hops aren't too pronounced; hint of bready notes

Name: Blacklist
Taste: Well balanced; not to bitter; slight coffee flavours

Name: Brocktoberfest
Taste: Crisp, well-balanced, sharp bitter flavours, hint of sweetness, bit of cloves taste

Name: Canadian Best Bitter
Taste: Nice hoppy flavours; not overly bitter, very well balanced

Name: Cause & Effect
Taste: Hops taste is slightly overpowering, expected a bit more of a fruity taste. Otherwise it's a crisp, clean tasting beer
Finish: Hint of lingering barley once the beer goes down, great finish

Name: Cup & Saucer English Ale
Aroma: Smells really crisp, sort of caramel-y
Taste: Well rounded caramel flavour, slightly bitter. Crisp, clean, really easy to drink

Name: Darkwood Blackberry Saison
Taste: Sweet berry flavours, fizzy, with a hint of bitterness. Super crisp, very drinkable.

Name: Detour
Taste: Well balanced hoppy and fruity flavours

Name: Down with the crispness
Aroma: Not a whole lot of aroma; slightly yeasty
Taste: Balanced hoppy flavours, super smooth

Name: Draught-style Vanilla Porter
Taste: Frothy, very sweet -- really getting that vanilla extract, hint of malty flavour, sort of caramel-y, hint of bitterness but not completely sure where it's coming from, full-bodied

Name: East Calgary Lager
Aroma: Smells sort of like a tea
Taste: Light beer, balanced

Name: Extra Special Bitter
Taste: Distinct sweet taste, almost like drinking a maple drink, with a hint of hoppy bitterness. Very drinkable, no off-tastes

Name: Hard Cider
Taste: Not overly sweet

Name: Heff Bridges
Taste: Fizzy, taste of cloves, banana, slightly hoppy, tart, sweet, crisp, very drinkable

Name: Hobgoblin
Description: Translucent, Dark Red, around half an inch of head
Taste: Very carbonated, light malt taste, smooth, slight bitterness

Name: Holiday Cheers - Winter Spice Ale
Aroma: Cinammon, nutmeg notes; bit of hops
Taste: Definitely getting that cinammon flavour, mixture of other spices, crisp, bit of bitterness, not overly dry when drinking it

Name: Maclean's Pale Ale
Taste: Strong malty flavour, mild carbonation

Name: Mad and Noisy - Lagered Ale
Taste: Crisp, fairly sweet -- sort of like honey, hint of bitterness from the grain, fairly bubbly -- you can feel it fizzing in your mouth

Name: Maple Butter Tart Ale
Aroma: Maple-y, toffee, butterscotch aroma; super sweet scent
Taste: The toffee, sweet flavours really stand out, along with a hint of toast-like flavours. Quite crisp, quite light, very drinkable

Name: Mayday Belgian Pale Ale
Description: Amber, Transparent, a bit too much head -- the beer fizzes right up
Aroma: Not much of an aroma, hint of yeast
Taste: Didn't taste like much at first: slightly bitter; but a subtle hint of sweetness comes after -- really well balanced

Name: McNall's Mission
Taste: Honey sweetness, with hints of bitterness. Very crisp, very light

Name: Mountain Lager
Aroma: Slightly sweet, banana, clove aroma, hint of hops
Taste: Sweet, refreshing, light wheat notes, fizzy, hint of hops
Finish: Slightly hoppy finish, but overall clean

Name: On Blueberry Hill (Blueberry Stout)
Aroma: Blueberry, cherry, dark chocolate aroma; very sweet
Taste: Initially crisp (like a light beer), really well balanced: blueberry-esque sweetness + sourness along with a hint of bitterness; hint of bready flavour

Name: One Summer in Saskatoon
Taste: Rich hoppy tastes with a hint of citrus, slightly fizzy

Name: Rifleman's Ration Brown Ale
Taste: Rich caramel flavours, slightly bitter, decent amount of carbonation, bright sweet flavours, a bit frothy

Name: Rolling Rock
Taste: Enveloping, slightly bitter taste. Very crisp beer actually

Name: Session Seven
Taste: Slightly bitter; lots of fruity flavours, slightly pine-y; fairly balanced; relatively easy beer to drink

Name: Smoked Honey
Aroma: Sweet honey, and a tad bit of smokey aroma
Taste: Coats your mouth with a toasted, smokey flavour. A hint of fizz and a hint of bitterness.

Name: Southern Ale
Aroma: Bready, hint of sweet, fruity notes
Taste: Quite bready and sweet; very clean tasting beer

Name: St-Ambroise Citrouille (The Great Pumpkin Ale)
Aroma: Strong pumpkin spice notes, reminds me of a whiskey
Taste: Lots of carbonation. Sweet with hints of pumpkin and cinammon-like spices

Name: Swing Bridge
Aroma: not much aroma; hint of yeast
Taste: Much more wheaty, bitter tasting than I expected. Very smooth, just enough carbonation to give your tongue a tingle. Really clean flavour

Name: The All-Nighter Vanilla Cappuccino Porter
Taste: Tastes straight up like coffee with a hint of vanilla and alcohol

Name: This Must Be The IPA
Aroma: Hoppy, orange peel sort of smell
Taste: Clean hoppy taste

Name: True North Inukshuk IPA
Taste: Surprisingly light and crisp; slight bitterness, well-balanced
Finish: Clean finish; hint of wheaty aftertaste

Name: 12 Mile (India Pale Lager)
Taste: Initially sweet, strong bitter flavours follow -- slightly unbalanced

Name: 3 Speed
Taste: Pure, wheaty taste with some carbonation. Very light
Finish: Goes down great, with little aftertaste

Name: Batch 1904
Taste: Tastes like an apple cider, slightly more dry

Name: Brown Ale
Aroma: Mostly coffee, with a hint of roasted aromas
Taste: Crisp, nutty flavours, slightly malty

Name: Cheeky Bastard Stout
Taste: Frothy; balanced; hint of coffee, dark chocolatey flavour; but, it falls a bit flat, wish there was a bit more impact

Name: Dab Export
Taste: Fizzy. Light. Slight taste of grains, as well as a hint of sweetness
Finish: Clean finish, slight aftertaste of grains

Name: Dandelion's Blonde
Taste: Light beer, fizzy

Name: Doc Perdue's Bobcat
Taste: Slight citrus flavour, along with a tad of hoppy flavour. Mildly fizzy.

Name: Farmstead Ale
Taste: Really light on the hops; slightly bitter, slightly wheaty, hint of sweetness and a bit of combination. Fairly balanced overall

Name: Fat Tire Amber Ale
Taste: Crisp, clear, slightly sweet with a hint of wheaty, malty flavours. Nothing too special

Name: Gahan Blueberry Ale
Taste: Intially sweet -- the bitterness of the blueberries follows, which throws you off, the wheat comes very last. Bit of a weird (not a foul one, just weird) taste -- very disconnected

Name: Harbinger
Aroma: Sweet notes, with a slight bitterness
Taste: Well-balanced between bitter and sweet, also slightly hoppy. Medium carbonation, you feel a slight sting in your mouth

Name: Harvest Ale
Taste: Slightly nutty taste, brings out more of a hoppy, bitter flavour, with slight carbonation.

Name: Hawaiian style pale ale
Taste: Balanced, not too hoppy, slightly tart

Name: Heller Highwater
Taste: Crisp, clean, well-balanced
Finish: Dry finish, hint of wheaty flavours

Name: Hockley Dark
Taste: Hint of spices, neutral taste, clean

Name: Icelandic Arctic Pale Ale
Aroma: Fruity, bready, hint of copper, slightly sugary
Taste: Malty, hint of copper, slightly fruity, hoppy, fairly well balanced

Name: Iron Pig Pale Ale
Aroma: Very sharp citrus aroma, almost stings the nose (might actually be coming from the spices
Taste: Slightly citrus-y, but getting more hoppy, malty flavours. Hint of fizz

Name: La Cloche Belgian Blonde
Aroma: More powerful of an aroma than I was expecting: slightly fruity, bit of beer, bit of spice. Sort of yeasty as well
Taste: Crisp; slight tingle on the tongue, probably from the hint of spice; slightly sweet, not too overpowering

Name: Life in the Clouds
Taste: Pack of fruity flavours, hops aren't overbearing; very well balanced strong beer

Name: Lions Winter Ale
Taste: Fizzy, slightly sweet, slightly bitter, vanilla notes. The taste is generally balanced, but is quite disconnected from the aroma.
Finish: Slight lingering chocolate aftertaste as well as a hint of bitterness

Name: London Porter
Taste: Hint of sweetness, fairy balanced, oaty flavours, slightly bitter, hint of coffee, easy to drink

Name: Mise en Scene
Taste: Hoppy; fruity; zesty

Name: Original 16 - Prairie White
Taste: Light carbonation, hint of citrus (orange), not really getting any spices, bit of bitterness

Name: Pale Ale
Taste: Slightly fizzy, a very vibrant malty flavour that you wouldn't expect out of a pale ale
Finish: Slight hoppy, bready aftertaste, but goes down really well

Name: Peachy keen
Taste: Tastes like a fruit gummy with a bit of bitterness. Really weak tasting though

Name: Peanut Butter Shake
Taste: One of the most interesting beers I've drank. Tastes like Reese's peanut butter cup, but a bit unbalanced: bitter flavour throws off the taste a bit, wish it was a tad bit more sweet

Name: Porter
Taste: Rich, malty, sweet taste accompanied with a contrasting bitter flavour. Very balanced

Name: Queen Street 501
Taste: Very sharp apple cider flavours, sweet

Name: Radler
Aroma: Lemons, with a hint of hoppy scent
Taste: Tastes of a sweetened wine

Name: Remembrance Red Ale
Aroma: Bright caramel-y aroma, hint of hops
Taste: Bitter profile, with a hint of sweetness, bit fizzy, crisp

Name: Riley Red
Taste: Light bitter flavours, slightly fizzy, very clean

Name: Shinnicked Stout
Taste: Bready, malty, like drinking straight from the coffee filter. Fairly drinkable, no off flavours; medium bodied
Finish: Smooth finish; hint of coffee, but not much else

Name: Temescal Hazy IPA
Taste: Fairly well balanced--fruity sweet with a swig of hoppy flavours

Name: Trappist - Tripel
Taste: Frothy, slighty fizz, hoppy flavours, hint of tartness, dry

Name: Trestle Golden Ale
Taste: Bright, sweet, slightly dry, not too bitter, light

Name: Westfalia
Taste: Fairly crisp, dry, hint of toffee, malty notes

Name: Witching hour
Aroma: Cinnamon aroma, definitely some other spices in there as well; really light
Taste: Tastes like a pumpkin spice drink; light cinnamon flavour; has a kick of carbonation

Aroma: Slightly bitter scent; hint of banana
Taste: Medium carbonation, slightly bitter flavour

Name: Absent Landlord
Taste: Overly fizzy, and very light. Slightly bitter and slightly sweet

Name: Armchair Scotch Ale
Taste: Buttery, nutty flavours, hint of bitterness. Flavours aren't as strong as expected; fairly light actually.

Name: Black Coal Stout
Aroma: Not much aroma, a hint of lemon-y, smokey scent
Taste: Very smooth. Lacking in flavour; hints of sweetness and bitterness, sort of nutty, and then the flavour just disappears

Name: Bud light
Taste: Honey-like sweetness, wheaty, light, fairly standard beer without much of the bitter

Name: Carling Ice
Aroma: Smells like a beer, bit of citrus
Taste: Light, watered-down, apple cider like drink. No distinctive tastes

Name: Chocolate Blossom
Aroma: chocolate aroma, with cherry sweetness; yeasty aroma
Taste: Oddly bitter, frothy, hint of chocolate taste; was expecting more balance between the cherry sweetness and the bitterness of the chocolate

Name: Common Loon
Taste: Hint of citrus, but mainly overpowered by a stronger bitter flavour
Finish: Goes down smooth, slight lingering bitterness

Name: Conscience IPA
Taste: Strong hoppy flavours, along with a bit of tartness; very unbalanced

Name: Creamy ale
Taste: Slightly hoppy, carbonated, wheaty

Name: Dark Horse Stout
Aroma: Coffee, chocolate-y aroma, hint of breadiness
Taste: Hint of bitterness, fairly standard stout

Name: Dockside
Taste: Fairly regular beer, no distinguishing characteristics, and certainly no offensive flavours

Name: Duggan's #5 Sorachi Lager
Taste: Light flavours; bit too carbonated, feels prickly; hint of bitterness from the hops

Name: Elijah's Real McCoy (Lager)
Aroma: Hint of grains, floral notes, sweet
Taste: Tastes like a lager would, nothing striking; well-balanced, sweet and bitter; straw-like taste; slightly hoppy

Name: Henry's Hard Soda
Taste: Sweet with a slight alcoholic taste

Name: IPA Beer
Taste: Strong hoppy flavours; pretty much like every other IPA beer

Name: Keith's Red
Taste: Crisp, not a huge flavour profile: slightly bitter, slightly bready

Name: Kolsch
Aroma: Smells just like a ordinary beer
Taste: Crisp, with a slight bitter taste. Tasted like a regular beer
Finish: Almost clean finish, slight lingering bitterness

Name: Lagunitas IPA
Taste: Punch of hops, hint of orange peel, pineapple; nothing really stands out

Name: London Stout
Taste: Hints of toffee, chocolate, coffee; nothing particularly outstanding, tastes like a stout.
Finish: Slightly alcohol-y aftertaste, with a hint of bready notes

Name: Lone Pine IPA
Taste: Light flavours, balanced, nothing surprising

Name: Mango on the Run - Mango IPA
Taste: More bitterness than expected, not really getting any other flavours. Definitely no hint of sweetness
Finish: Bitter finish, with a hint of breadiness

Name: Matcha Beer
Aroma: Smells like a matcha tea with a hint of beer
Taste: Pretty much just tastes like matcha powder mixed with beer, and the beer is very watered-down. It is quite refreshing, however. Earthy. Hint of malty flavours.
Finish: Bitter(-ish) finish from that matcha powder, not from the beer itself

Name: Naughty Otter Lager
Aroma: Smells like a beer, not a particularly strong aroma of anything else
Taste: Crisp, hint of bready flavours, hint of bitterness, fizz packs a punch
Finish: Slightly hoppy finish, with a hint of alcohol

Name: Octopus Wants to Fight IPA
Description: Golden yellow, translucent, an inch or so of head
Aroma: Strong aroma of yeast and hops with a hint of sweetness
Taste: Crisp, clean taste, well balanced, hops are not overpowering; nothing offensive, and nothing crazy

Name: Railside (Session Ale)
Taste: Regular hoppy taste, with slight carbonation

Name: Schvenko 9
Taste: Slight bitterness, sort of reminds you of coffee. No other distinguishing characteristics. Well-balanced

Name: Slow Burn Smoked Porter
Aroma: Slighty smokey, otherwise not a lot of aroma
Taste: Subtle smokey flavors

Name: Space Invader IPA
Taste: Slightly unbalanced -- strong bitter flavours; very hoppy

Name: Sparkle Pony
Aroma: Banana, cloves, faintly tropical, reminds me of Das Spritzhaus
Taste: Initially sweet, then dies out. Less of a flavour profile than expected. Pretty much tastes like nothing after that initial sweetness

Name: Special Pale Ale
Aroma: Slightly bitter scent; smells like a beer
Taste: Carbonated; slightly bitter

Name: Taco Truck Lager
Taste: Slightly bitter, crisp, hints of bready flavours

Name: Wicked Awesome IPA
Taste: Standard IPA taste, fruity, hoppy

Name: 3-point Saison
Taste: Fizzy, slightly sweet
Finish: Weird finish, sort of like orange peels

Name: Birch Bark
Aroma: Distinct IPA aroma: hoppy, slightly fruity
Taste: Tastes like any other IPA, though a tad on the weaker side
Finish: Weird, alcoholic finish, as if I'd just drank some stronger liquer

Name: Cobblestone Nitro Stout
Taste: Hint  of milk chocolate taste, coffee, quite bitter

Name: Daybreak
Taste: Bitter flavours stand out too much, slightly creamy

Name: Deeeper Haus stout
Taste: Oddly bitter and tart, there is nothing else in this beer
Finish: Very bitter finish, hint of oats

Name: El Sully Lager
Taste: Quite dry, hint of wheat sweetness

Name: Farmer's Daughter
Taste: Light beer taste

Name: Hazy Little Thing IPA
Taste: Watered down hoppy, fruity flavours

Name: Keith's IPA
Taste: Fizzy, bready, less of a flavour profile than expected, crisp, slightly bitter

Name: Mad and Noisy - Coconut Porter
Taste: Malty, roasted flavours, really light; no hint of coconut despite what the name suggests

Name: Oat'oberfest
Taste: Not getting a whole lot from this; slight carbonation; light bready flavours
Finish: Just dies; sort of like drinking water

Name: Permium Beer
Aroma: Not much aroma, hint of lemon
Taste: Tastes like a generic beer, hint of hops, crisp, clean

Name: Prinz of Darkness
Aroma: Not much aroma, bit of sweetness
Taste: Strong hoppy flavours, not getting much of anything else. Doesn't really taste like a dark beer

Name: San Rafael '71 Pale  Ale
Taste: Wheaty, hoppy flavour, sort of like a Belgian Moon
Finish: Goes down with a hoppy aftertaste

Name: Shindig
Aroma: Classic cheap sort of beer aroma
Taste: Very carbonated, light, slightly malty sweet; the bitterness stands out way more however

Name: Tree Topper Red Ale
Aroma: Malty, caramel-y aroma, with a hint of sweetness
Taste: Bit of hops, bit of alcohol, but nothing else really from this

Name: Tuborg Gold
Aroma: Smells like the most generic beer possible, i.e. like piss and worse
Taste: Tastes like a generic beer, really fizzy, no defining qualities

Name: Viking Sterkur
Taste: Quite crisp, not a lot of flavour, slightly bitter, strong "alcohol" taste, hint of honey

Name: Waterloo IPA
Taste: Sharp and imbalanced bitter flavour

Name: 35 & 118 Cream Ale
Taste: Crisp, light, not much to this beer. It tastes like nothing

Name: Abbot Ale
Taste: Tastes of tequila

Name: Cracked Canoe
Taste: Unexpected sharp bitter taste, sort of tart; very bubbly, tastes like low-quality beer

Name: Dortmunder
Taste: Awkwardly bitter, malty, dry

Name: Jumis (Baltic Porter)
Aroma: Not a lot of aroma with this beer
Taste: Slightly sweet, sour
Finish: Sweet finish followed by a cough syrup like taste

Name: Midnight Kissed My Cow (Double Chocolate Milk Stout)
Taste: Really fizzy -- almost prickly. Definitely getting milk chocolate, as well as a metallic, coppery taste, but that's pretty much it -- nothing much else
Finish: Initially bitter, then you get some of that milk chocolate taste

Name: Viking 2.25%
Taste: Fairly generic beer: slightly bready, sweet, fizzy, crisp

Name: Village IPA
Taste: Tastes like an IPA

Name: White Space Wheat
Aroma: Wonderful aroma: orange, citrus, hint of tea,
Taste: Tastes like watered down beer along with some tea. I literally made this the other day with green tea and an ale

Name: Banquet
Taste: Completely bitter

Name: Grøn Tuborg
Aroma: Bready, malty notes, hints of metallic aroma
Taste: Tastes like a generic beer, fizzy, crispy, pretty much getting nothing from this beer

Name: Steam Whistle
Taste: Tastes like a mass-produced beer, super bitter

Name: Egils Pilsner
Taste: Oddly bitter; sharp unpleasant, tangy taste; metallic; really strongly flavoured for a light looking beer

Name: Immodest Imperial IPA
Taste: Tries to be sweet and citrus-y, but misses the mark. Tastes more like the peel than the citrus itself
Finish: Bitter flavours linger in your mouth, long after the beer is gone

Name: Truly Spiked and Sparkling
Taste: Slightly like soda, then the alcohol taste comes through. But the taste is super flat and watered down

Name: CDN pale ale
Taste: Unexpectedly bitter (not from hops), no hints of any other flavours
Finish: Bitter, super astringent (like eating the orange peel) finish

Name: Monty's Aged Ryed Ale
Taste: Really bitter, oaky flavour. Super strong alcohol taste. Not a huge fan of it; kind of like a whiskey, but much worse

Name: Premium Lager
Aroma: Slight lychee aroma, otherwise standard piss smell
Taste: Weirdly bitter, a bit crisp

Name: Prophets and Nomads
Aroma: Unpleasant scent, sort of like urine
Taste: Does not taste like a beer, had trouble swallowing this one. Salty and nasty

Name: Wind Shear Watermelon Summer Ale
Taste: Terribly unbalanced; watermelon flavours aren't sweet, very nasty bitternness, not much beer flavours to it
